page.title: 10THE OLD SCHOOL-LIBRARY
page.content: St.Margaret's Library was once the village school.This was built in 1847 and was used as a school until 1971 when the school was transferred to a new building. In 1971 St.Margarets Bay Trust took it over and converted it into a community centre.It is now used by a playgroup,a luncheon club and the library as well as being available for meetings of clubs or societies for a small fee. When Paul,Tony and Garry interviewed the part-time librarian Mrs Dixon,she told them there were about 3000 books in this library.Sometimes books are stolen from us and not returned but they usually turn up at jumble sales. The most regular customers are elderly people.
